image.altText: A man in a patterned shirt leans back on a red and silver Jeep with the Jurassic Park logo on the car door

props.synopsis: Zakary Weyer's obsession with Jurassic Park drove him to learn different skills to build a replica of the Jeep that appears in the iconic blockbuster.

title.children: Jurassic Park fan fulfils childhood dream of recreating Jeep

image.altText: Spectacular colourful fireworks over Sydney Harbour

props.synopsis: Revellers welcomed 2026 at various sites across Australia's major cities, including Sydney, where there was a heavy police presence in the wake of the Bondi terror attack earlier this month.

title.children: NYE fireworks light up cities across Australia amid heightened security

image.altText: Adelaide Strikers batter Chris Lynn looks over his shoulder after a shot in a Big Bash League game against Brisbane Heat.

props.synopsis: Former Brisbane star Chris Lynn clobbers the Adelaide Strikers to an easy victory over the Heat in the New Year's Eve Big Bash League clash.

title.children: Lynn's fireworks get Strikers over the line in NYE clash for first time since 2018

image.altText: Katie Wahlheim sits with two border collie dogs, as one looks up with his snout very close to her face

props.synopsis: Within 20 minutes of leaving an Adelaide beach dogs Lucy and Ella began breathing rapidly and fell "terribly sick", prompting their owner to issue a warning.

title.children: Pet owner's warning as dog left 'frothing' after SA beach visit

image.altText: An orange old fashioned car on a road

props.synopsis: Despite becoming unofficial several years ago, a community-driven event has attracted about 1,000 drivers and even more spectators in Adelaide.

title.children: Car culture rolling strong in Adelaide as unofficial event attracts thousands

image.altText: Darren standing in his backyard, clutching at the net which covers his fruit free.

props.synopsis: There was no fruit fly to be found in Broken Hill 20 years ago, but now gardeners are facing an uphill battle trying to rid themselves of the pest.

title.children: Outback gardeners continue 30-year battle with destructive fruit pest

image.altText: Beth in a hard hat covered in soot

props.synopsis: TV presenter and former builder Barry Du Bois is lobbying Canberra for change.

title.children: First apprenticeship 'hell' for tradie who wants hazing to stop

image.altText: A young boy with golden curly hair smiles as he sits by a table with playing sand

props.synopsis: As 2025 draws to a close and we look back at the stories that made headlines, for South Australians the year could be summarised as one where we searched for answers, with little results.

title.children: A year SA searched for answers, but came up short

image.altText: A glass sculture with a tall, light blue patterned base and a purple bowl on top.

props.synopsis: The art of glassblowing was popularised in a recent reality TV series, but these Australian artists are forging their own paths in the creative process of sculpting this tricky medium.

title.children: Meet the young artists pushing the boundaries of glassmaking

image.altText: outback drone

props.synopsis: It's more than 1,000km from any capital city, but Cameron Corner, at the junction of the NSW, Queensland and South Australian borders, reckons it has one of the best New Year's Eve parties going around because it is a triple celebration over three time zones.

title.children: Outback revellers celebrate three New Year's Eves in one night

image.altText: the back of a police officer watching the Adelaide Entertainment Centre tram stop

props.synopsis: Police have been given expanded powers to search people for weapons on every public bus, train and tram in the Adelaide metropolitan area ahead of New Year Eve's celebrations.

title.children: Police given extra search powers at all Adelaide public transport sites

image.altText: A large crack in a concrete slab.

props.synopsis: It is not unheard of for the ground to shake in Broken Hill, but what is unusual is the number of earthquakes recorded by Geoscience Australia this year.

title.children: Outback city rumbles through a record year of ground shaking

image.altText: white woman with dreads taking a selfie in a bar

props.synopsis: Outback towns remain cut-off, and floodwaters are expected to linger in the north-west for weeks. Graziers have started to assess their properties and count any stock losses.

title.children: Stranded travellers welcome in new year in the bush as floods cut roads

image.altText: Donald Trump stands in front of a microphone.

props.synopsis: Australia’s top economists talk interest rate hikes and market movements.

title.children: Follow the money as 2026's economy asks big questions of all of us

image.altText: A man in combat uniform lying down, and holding a cigarette in one hand.

props.synopsis: Russell Allan Wilson, who spent several years fighting for Ukraine, has been remembered as someone who "gave his life so others could keep theirs".

title.children: Australian soldier fighting for Ukraine 'killed week before wedding'

image.altText: A Palestinian carries a box of food from the World Food Program with a group of other men.

props.synopsis: The Israeli government says the organisations have not met new requirements, which include recognising Israel as a Jewish and democratic state and banning any so-called "de-legitimisation" of Israel.

title.children: 'Simply unprecedented': Israel banning dozens of charities from Gaza

image.altText: A large crowds gathered around a stage with pyrotechnics at a music festival.

props.synopsis: A pill testing trial has been expanded to Sydney's Field Day music festival, but authorities are urging partygoers not to be complacent.

title.children: High-dose MDMA warning for New Year's Day music festival in Sydney

image.altText: two men with champagne on a yacht

props.synopsis: They should be celebrating a historic win. Instead, the crew of BNC is coming to terms with how a "silly mistake" — their words — cost them the "crown jewel" prize of the Sydney to Hobart overall handicap.

title.children: How a 'silly mistake' cost these men Sydney to Hobart glory

image.altText: A photo of John Cain.

props.synopsis: Previously secret cabinet documents from the Labor governments of John Cain Jr and Joan Kirner have been released to the public for the first time.

title.children: Cabinet documents from one of Victoria's most influential governments released

image.altText: Black and white image of three men speaking into microphones.

props.synopsis: The cabinet documents were originally sealed in 1995. Today, they shed light on the decision-making processes of the government of the day.

title.children: Qld government releases Wayne Goss cabinet documents sealed for 30 years

image.altText: A close up of a Māori man, black hair, tanned, beard stubble, wearing black singlet as he looks out on the ocean.

props.synopsis: Shalom Kaa used to think running was something other people did. But after a series of events that left him at his lowest, running became a big part of his recovery following years of substance abuse with crystal methamphetamines.

title.children: How running helped Shalom overcome years of substance abuse

image.altText: People being helped out of a train carriage window as onlookers look shocked.

props.synopsis: A head-on collision between two tourist trains near Peru's most famous landmark kills a train driver and injures dozens.

title.children: Five Australians safe after fatal train crash near Machu Picchu

image.altText: Central Coast Mariners' Matt Simon shouts during a tunnel confrontation with the Brisbane Roar during an A-League match.

props.synopsis: The send-off of Brisbane Roar coach Michael Valkanis is the catalyst for a confrontation in the tunnel at Gosford Stadium, with Mariners coach Warren Moon calling it "a disgrace" and "an embarrassment".

title.children: Police involved as Roar and Mariners clash at half-time of A-League game

image.altText: Evonne Goolagong holding on to the Australian Open trophy in 1974.

props.synopsis: After an extended break and a shower, Goolagong changed tactics in the deciding set to sail to victory over American Chris Evert back in 1974.

title.children: Shower and tactical change helped Goolagong win first Australian Open

image.altText: Nick McKenzie wearing a blue suit and tie

props.synopsis: Investigators from a taskforce targeting crime in the construction industry say a 31-year-old man threatened journalist Nick McKenzie in a Christmas Eve call.

title.children: Man charged with making threatening phone call to Melbourne journalist

image.altText: A police crime scene.

props.synopsis: Two men were taken to hospital with serious injuries after being stabbed in Carlton shortly before midnight.

title.children: Police investigate Melbourne NYE double stabbing

image.altText: Three portrait-style photos of white men sit on top of a map of an island

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has identified several individuals involved in a network of illegitimate corporate regulators and service firms.

title.children: How illegitimate regulators operate in the name of a tiny African island

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: A man and a woman will face court charged with numerous offences, including manufacturing unauthorised explosive devices.

title.children: Police find explosives, arrest two people in Bendigo suburb

image.altText: Damien Martyn plays in the nets

props.synopsis: Former Australian Test and limited overs batsman Damien Martyn is in hospital in Queensland in an induced coma after falling ill this week.

title.children: Ex-Australian cricketer Damien Martyn seriously ill in induced coma

image.altText: A boat dingy capsized on rocks near ocean.

props.synopsis: Police confirmed one man has drowned and a 14-year-old boy is missing after their boat capsized at Palm Beach on Sydney's Northern Beaches, with a search and rescue helicopter continuing to search the area.

title.children: Man dead and 14yo boy missing after boat capsizes at Sydney beach

image.altText: A woman gestures as she speaks into a microphone at a lectern

props.synopsis: There are just two toilets for women near the main hall in Japan's parliament, with nearly 60 MPs calling for changes to the building to match growing female representation.

title.children: Female MPs in Japan want more toilets in parliament

image.altText: Firefighter in the field at Dolphin Sands, December 2025.

props.synopsis: After 19 homes were destroyed by bushfire in a picturesque east coast Tasmanian community, residents are now reporting instances of looting — described by the state premier as "disgraceful".

title.children: 'Disgraceful' acts of looting in bushfire-ravaged community

image.altText: Men walk in front of people standing on a footpath giving them roses

props.synopsis: The release is a key part of a ceasefire deal struck to bring peace to the border between the two countries.

title.children: 'I am so happy': Crowd celebrates Thailand's release of Cambodian soldiers

image.altText: One of the main entrances to Crown Casino in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: About 500 workers at Melbourne's Crown casino will stop work on Wednesday after rejecting a proposal they say will cut pay for new workers and imperil those currently employed.

title.children: Crown casino workers announce New Year's Eve strike amid wage row

image.altText: Cricket commentator Alex Hartley wears a white sleeveless top.

props.synopsis: Alex Hartley says she was stunned by the reaction to her talking about her period during the BBC's radio commentary of the third Ashes Test.

title.children: Calls for critics to 'grow up' after outcry over period mention on BBC
